devdoc.author: Icebear & Crash Bandicoot
devdoc.details: ALL "fee" variables are limited by PERCENTAGE_DENOMINATOR = 100% Note refer to DataStoreUtils before reviewing

changeMaintainer(DataStoreUtils.DataStor.details: it is wise to change the CONTROLLER before the maintainer, in case of any migrationhandle with care NOTE intended (suggested) usage is to set a contract address that will govern the id for maintainer, while keeping the controller as a multisig or provide smt like 0x000000000000000000000000000000000000dEaD

getMaintainerFromId(DataStoreUtils.DataS.details: every ID has one maintainer that is set by CONTROLLER

returns.walletBalance: the balance of Operator with the given _operatorId has

initiateComet(DataStoreUtils.DataStore s.details: requires ID to be approved as comet with a specific CONTROLLER, NOTE CONTROLLER check will be surpassed with portal.

initiateOperator(DataStoreUtils.DataStor.details: requires ID to be approved as a node operator with a specific CONTROLLER

initiatePlanet(DataStoreUtils.DataStore.details: requires ID to be approved as a planet with a specific CONTROLLER

devdoc.title: MaintainerUtils library to be used with a DataStore

FEE_SWITCH_LATENCY().notice: when a maintainer changes the fee, it is effective after a delay

changeMaintainer(DataStoreUtils.DataStor.notice: CONTROLLER of the ID can change the maintainer to any address other than ZERO_ADDRESS

getMaintainerFromId(DataStoreUtils.DataS.notice: "Maintainer" is a shared logic (like "NAME") by both operators and private or public pools. Maintainers have permissiones to maintain the given id like setting a new fee or interface as well as creating validators etc. for operators.

getMaintainerWalletBalance(DataStoreUtil.notice: When a fee is collected it is put in the maintainer's walletMaintainer wallet also keeps Ether put in Portal by Operator Maintainer to make proposeStake easier, instead of sending n ETH to contract while preStaking for n validator(s) for each time. Operator can put some ETHs to their wallet and from there, ETHs can be used to proposeStake. Then when it is approved and staked, it will be added back to the wallet to be used for other proposeStake calls.

initiateComet(DataStoreUtils.DataStore s.notice: initiates ID as a comet (private pool)

initiateOperator(DataStoreUtils.DataStor.notice: initiates ID as a node operator

initiatePlanet(DataStoreUtils.DataStore.notice: initiates ID as a planet (public pool): deploys a miniGovernance, a Dynamic Withdrawal Pool, an ERC1155Interface

switchMaintainerFee(DataStoreUtils.DataS.notice: Changes the fee that is applied by distributeFee on Oracle Updates.

userdoc.notice: for Geode, there are different TYPEs active within Staking operations. These types(4,5,6) always has a maintainer. The staking logic is shaped around the control of maintainers over pools.
